diff_hunk:
@@ -4250,7 +4250,8 @@ def matmul_on_gpu(n):
       A context manager that specifies the default device to use for newly
       created ops.
     """
-    self._add_device_to_stack(device_name_or_function, offset=2)
+    offset = 2 if (len(tf_stack.extract_stack()) > 2) else 1
body: Instead of doing this, can you edit https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/traceable_stack.py#L64 to return FAILURE if negative_offset is out of range? I think that's a more general solution, and I don't think the stack frame will be useful from R anyway.

I think that's a more general solution, and I don't think the stack frame will be useful from R anyway.
body_text: Instead of doing this, can you edit https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/traceable_stack.py#L64 to return FAILURE if negative_offset is out of range? I think that's a more general solution, and I don't think the stack frame will be useful from R anyway.
